explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 asks that pointer types be const-qualified when they can be (i.e., when the pointed-to data is never modified through that pointer). In this code the struct member is declared as uint8_t *buffer because the same lfs_cache_t type is used both for read-only cache references (pcache passed as const lfs_cache_t *pcache) and for caches that are written into (rcache and lfs->rcache where the buffer is the target of reads). Declaring the member as const uint8_t *buffer would prevent legitimate writes into rcache->buffer (e.g., lfs->cfg->read(..., rcache->buffer, ...)), so the member cannot be const-qualified globally. Passing a const lfs_cache_t *pcache correctly makes the struct object immutable in that call-site; reading from pcache->buffer (as done via memcpy) does not violate 8.13. Therefore there is no MISRA 8.13 violation in lfs_ctz_traverse/lfs_bd_read as shown.
